title: Leading Off: Calling All Geniuses
description: If nothing else, Game 5 of the World Series makes us want to hit the pause button on baseball history. Because even if you know only a little about the game, you know Tony La Russa is supposed to be a genius. He will tell you that himself. Baseball announcers will tell you. Over and over and over. Isnt it written in the rule book, right there with three strikes and youre out? The old skit was Whos on first, whats on second and Tony La Russa is a genius, wasnt it?

title: Conrans Long Run
description: The British design doyen Sir Terence Conran is showing signs of his 80 years. He sits in one of the Finnish designer Yrjo Kukkapuros Karuselli chairs not just because its a design classic, but also because its curves soothe his bones. I have a fairly bad back, he admits. But dont make the mistake of assuming that his retrospective exhibition, Terence Conran: The Way We Live Now, at the Design Museum in London from Nov. 16 through March 4, 2012, is a swan song.

title: In the Arctic, a Debate Over New Resources and Old
description: Shell Oil has received preliminary permits to drill exploratory wells off the coast of Alaska as soon as next summer, but its rigs would work in age-old whale-hunting grounds.

title: Banks Face Pressure on Eve of Meeting on Debt Crisis
description: BRUSSELS  European officials scrambled on Tuesday for a way to entice banks to accept much deeper losses on their Greek bonds as debt crisis talks went down to the wire before a crucial gathering of European leaders on Wednesday.

title: After Leaving Football, a Historian Emerges as an N.C.A.A. Critic
description: When Taylor Branch and his wife, Christy, exchanged vows in 1978, Branch had to do more than promise to remain faithful through sickness and health: he also had to give up football.

title: House Writes a Bill to Excuse U.S. Carriers
description: One of the stranger bills to be considered by Congress passed by a voice vote on Monday evening. Officially named the European Union Emissions Trading Scheme Prohibition Act of 2011, it essentially tells American airline carriers that it is illegal for them to participate in the European Unions cap and trade system, which charges companies for producing emissions beyond their allotted limit.

title: Arctic Village Is Torn by Plan for Oil Drilling
description: POINT HOPE, Alaska  He once hurled harpoons at whales, but on this platinum afternoon beside the Arctic Ocean he swung a 5-iron at a frustrating little ball.

title: Cain Campaign Says Video Is Authentic
description: Has the first viral video of the campaign season come from the Herman Cain camp?

title: An Unnecessary Measles Outbreak
description: In a typical year, the Centers for Disease Control sees 60 to 70 cases of measles. As of Oct. 14, it had tracked 214 cases  the worst figure in 15 years.

title: Perrys Emphasis on Birther Issue: A Wink at the Right?
description: Rick Perry appears determined to make doubts about President Obamas birthplace an issue again in the Republican primary campaign even though Mr. Obama produced his long-form birth certificate months ago.

title: Wheelies: The Growth Hormone Edition
description: In which we bring you motoring news from around the Web:

title: Q. and A. With Toby Keith
description: Toby Keith has mellowed somewhat since the turbulent days after Sept. 11, 2001, when he became most known for his jingoistic songs supporting the troops in Iraq and Afghanistan. On recent albums he has shied away from patriotic material in favor of more soulful ballads, along with the well-made songs he has always produced about drinking, chasing girls, breaking up and living hard.

title: Yet Another Attempt to Waylay the Enterprise
description: The governor of Washington has joined the ranks of elected officials trying to steer a space shuttle away from New York City  if only temporarily.

title: Qaddafi, Son and Former Defense Aide Buried in Secret Place
description: MISURATA, Libya  After four days on public display in a meat locker here, the slowly decomposing corpses of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi, one of his sons and his former defense minister were buried in a predawn funeral at a secret location on Tuesday, a top military official said.

title: Spooky Sketches | Peter Som
description: T challenges 10 designers to turn everyday objects into killer Halloween costumes.

title: They (Still) Cant Go Home Again
description: In late September, residents of 5 of the 17 apartments at the idyllic Villa Charlotte Bront cooperative in the Bronx were waiting for permission to go home after Tropical Storm Irene caused a landslide at the building.

title: W. Virginia Is Close to Joining the Big 12
description: Big East football is at a critical crossroads. When West Virginias departure to the Big 12 becomes official, the conference will have only five teams, including one original member, Rutgers. What happens over the next week will determine whether the league will survive or divide.

title: Rick Perry and the 'Birther' Movement
description: In an interview, Mr. Perry insisted that he is not certain that Mr. Obama was born in the United States, linking himself to the so-called "birther" movement.

title: India's First Formula One Track
description: Race fans got a preview of Indias first Formula One track  the Buddh International Circuit outside Delhi- which opens officially at the end of October.

title: On Our Radar: Nebraska Lawmakers Will Meet on Keystone
description: Gov. Dave Heineman of Nebraska calls a special session of the state legislature to address growing concerns over the proposed Keystone XL pipeline, which would carry tar sands oil across one of the Midwests most important aquifers. [The Los Angeles Times]

title: MTV Basics: Top Minimalist Videos
description: Chuck Klostermans excellent memoir Fargo Rock City almost convinced me that I missed something by not caring about hair metal. But when it came to my own MTV viewing habits, I was always a minimalist  give me a concert clip, or even a bit of straight-on lip syncing to a good song, like this clip of Stevie Nicks and Tom Petty trading verses on the indelible Stop Draggin My Heart Around.

title: John Harwood Interviews Rick Perry
description: Presidential candidate Rick Perry sat down with John Harwood of The New York Times and CNBC to discuss his plan for a 20 percent flat rate on individual and corporate income.

title: Panel Endorses HPV Vaccine for Boys of 11
description: Boys and young men should be vaccinated against human papillomavirus, or HPV, to protect against anal and throat cancers that can result from sexual activity, a federal advisory committee said Tuesday.

title: M.L.S. Playoffs Still Foreign to Red Bulls Star
description: LITTLE FALLS, N.J.  There are many things Thierry Henry has come to terms with since joining the Red Bulls from Barcelona last year. But Major League Soccers playoff system will never be one of them.

title: Becoming Gaga and Minaj
description: Stephanie Rosenbloom and Simone Oliver get help from Patricia Field to put together a fashionable Halloween costume.

title: Carlin Street Resisted by His Old Church. Was It Something He Said?
description: Before the dirty words came the classroom pranks. The petty theft of subway riders fedoras. The visions of sneaking into confessional and acting as de facto priest for a day.

title: Embracing the Pop Star in Your Closet
description: WHEN New Yorkers want Halloween costumes with sartorial flair, they skip costume shops and drugstores and head instead to the Patricia Field boutique in the Bowery, where glitter wigs and bondage pants are the everyday garb of Ms. Fields regular customers.

title: Charging Your Devices Through Solar Power
description: Companies have offered dozens of products that are supposed to let you charge a mobile device through solar power. But most have failed dismally. Some take too long to charge even a single battery, while others come with tedious connectors and wires.

title: The Crisis in Long-Term Care
description: The apparent demise of the Class Act leaves many middle-income Americans struggling to cope with rising expenses for long-term care for family members, The Times reported on Tuesday.

title: N.C.A.A.s Grant Hike Proposal: Fair or Foul?
description: With Mark Emmert, the N.C.A.A. president, coming out in favor of increasing athlete grants by $2,000, have we finally started working through the issue of student-athletes being compensated for playing college sports? Or is it the opening of Pandoras box, deepening the competitive gulf between the larger, richer schools and the smaller, less cash-rich ones?

title: Space Invaders | Skateboarding and Post-Minimalism
description: What do skateboarding and post-minimalist art have in common? More than you might guess, as will be revealed at the Emily Harvey Foundation in SoHo when Redmond Entwistles Monuments (2009) and Raphael Zarkas Species of Spaces in Skateboarding (2008) screen together this week. These two short films individually examine two seemingly disparate subjects and their respective influences on public space in 1960s and 70s American suburbia.

title: A Photographic Call to Action
description: When Clyde Butcher first began exploring the Everglades in 1984, there was virtually nothing to photograph  it was one big ditch, he says. A century of destructive intrusions like artificial canals, levees, pumps and spillways had left the swamps in a fragile and broken state.

title: Japanese Brands Dominate Consumer Reports Reliability Survey, While Ford Falls 10 Spots
description: Japanese automakers continue to produce the most reliable passenger vehicles on the market, according to consumer data collected by Consumer Reports.

title: Images From the Infield in Game 5
description: Mike Tanier will provide Bats with updates on less than important developments from the World Series.

title: Iraqis Enjoy a Show With a Familiar Ring, but a Few Differences
description: BAGHDAD  The circus promoters blanketed Baghdad with fliers that showed tigers balancing on pedestals, poodles standing on each others shoulders and a woman dancing with a massive snake.

title: The Circus Comes to Baghdad
description: Promises of tigers and a massive snake aside didnt come to fruition, but cotton candy, sword swallowing and clowns are still drawing crowds.

title: Why Its Good for Romney to Be at 21 Percent
description: Hes the establishment favorite, the guy whos run before, the clear winner in most debates. He seems eminently electable. So why cant Mitt Romney close the deal with Republican voters?

title: Say Anything
description: Over the last couple of days, Ive been getting mail accusing me of consorting with Nazis. My immediate reaction was, what the heck? Then it clicked: the right wing is mounting a full-court press to portray Occupy Wall Street as an anti-Semitic movement, based, as far as I can tell, on one guy with a sign.

title: Lemon Makes Digital Copies of Paper Receipts
description: If youre like me, receipts seem to multiply in your wallet, balling up or shredding and generally making a mess, until I throw them away in annoyance. A new smartphone app called Lemon aims to address that problem, by making digital copies of your receipts and organizing them in handy files.

title: Morgan Stanley Forms New Bank Advisory Team
description: Morgan Stanley has formed a new team focused on advising banks worldwide on capital and financing issues, according to an internal memorandum obtained by DealBook.

title: Perry Calls His Flat Tax Proposal Bold Reform
description: GRAY COURT, S.C.  Gov. Rick Perry of Texas unveiled a plan on Tuesday to scrap the graduated income tax and replace it with a 20 percent flat rate. By throwing out rates as high as 35 percent and eliminating estate and investment taxes, the plan would grant a major tax cut for the wealthy. It is the centerpiece of an ambitious proposal that aims to overhaul political sacred cows like Social Security and Medicare while slashing the federal budget.

title: Obama Taps Into Hollywood in West Coast Swing
description: LOS ANGELES  With a morning taping of NBCs The Tonight Show on Tuesday, President Obama makes his fourth appearance on the couch opposite the host Jay Leno, in between mining for California gold at fund-raisers in Los Angeles and San Francisco.

title: Syrian Opposition Calls for Protection from Crackdown
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  A Syrian opposition group called on Tuesday for international protection from the governments military crackdown on protesters, a day before an Arab delegation was scheduled to arrive in Syria in an effort to resolve seven months of unrest in the country.

title: Perry Offers Plan to Save Social Security
description: Gov. Rick Perry of Texas on Tuesday offered his most detailed response yet to criticism that he views Social Security as a Ponzi scheme, spelling out changes to the federal retirement program that he said would save Social Security for future generations.

title: The Real Scare Is Not Being Scary
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  Chainsaws? Yawn. Bathtub electrocutions? Done them. Demented, blood-thirsty clowns? So 2001.

title: A New Look for Aquavit
description: Hakan Swahn and his partner, the chef Marcus Jernmark, have reconfigured their Nordic restaurant, Aquavit. What was the cafe area in the front is now the main restaurant, and though the furnishings include Swedish classics like Arne Jacobsen chairs, it is less formal than the previous dining room, which was in the back and is now for private parties. There are four- and seven-course prix-fixe menus for dinner,  la carte or three courses at lunch. Traditional Swedish specialties like herring dishes will now be served from late afternoon through evening in the bar and lounge.

title: Invitation to a Dialogue: Computers in School?
description: To the Editor:

title: Design Bookshelf | Brilliant
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Hey Chef! Get with the Program
description: Ive known George Faison for 25 years or more; he was a co-founder of DArtagnan and is now a co-owner of Debragga and Spitler, a New York meat wholesaler thats been doing business since 1924, and a main supplier to many of the citys best restaurants. This is a letter George sent late last week to a well-known chef, and one hell be sending to others. (Its worth noting, if for no other reason than to answer the inevitable question, which I asked myself, that George doesnt only sell naturally-raised meats  he sells industrially-produced stuff as well. But hes on a campaign to persuade the chefs who insist thats what they want to change their minds, and I know hed like to supply only the right stuff.) Ive changed nothing except misspellings.

title: Iran Makes New Arrests in Fraud Case
description: The Iranian authorities have widened their investigation into what they say is a record $2.6 billion embezzlement uncovered in a network of Iranian banks last month, interrogating at least 67 people and putting 31 of them under arrest, state media reported.

title: Archive Offers Rare Look Into Husseins Private Ruminations
description: During the 2003 invasion of Iraq, United States forces captured a voluminous archive of documents and recorded meetings that now offer a window into the private world of Saddam Hussein.

title: Tax Deal Lures NBC Sports to Connecticut
description: NBC and the governor of Connecticut, Dannel P. Malloy, made it official on Tuesday  much of NBCs sports operation will move to Stamford.

title: Wall St. Giants Seek a Piece of Nigerias Sovereign Fund
description: Wanted: A reliable overseas business partner to invest more than $1 billion presently trapped in Nigeria.

title: Plan for a New York Area Formula One Race Announced in New Jersey
description: 3:00 p.m. | Updated

title: A Village Divided
description: A plan to begin offshore drilling next year could change the way of life for the Inupiat Eskimos of Point Hope, Alaska.

title: Meetings With North Koreans End Without Date for Talks
description: GENEVA  United States and North Korean officials emerged from two days of meetings here agreeing they had narrowed their differences about negotiating on the Norths nuclear program, but they parted without fixing a date for further bilateral or multilateral talks.

title: Hero of New Starz Series Is Leonardo da Vinci, International Man of Mystery
description: The real-life Leonardo da Vinci had no extraordinary powers, other than a first-class intellect, unparalleled artistic skills and the ability to make millions of dollars for Dan Brown a few centuries down the road. But to the Starz cable channel Leonardo is enough of a champion to feature in a new series that was announced on Tuesday and which is being created for the channel by a writer with some serious superhero credentials.

title: Papers From Iraqi Archive Reveal Conspiratorial Mind-Set of Hussein
description: WASHINGTON  On Nov. 15, 1986, Saddam Hussein gathered his most senior aides for an important strategy session.Two days earlier, President Ronald Reagan had acknowledged in a televised address that his administration had sent weapons and spare parts to Iran.

title: Its a No-Brainer: AMC Orders Third Season of The Walking Dead
description: After a recent episode of The Walking Dead that vividly revealed the contents of a zombies stomach, AMC has decided it still has a healthy appetite for that popular series about the survivors of an undead apocalypse.

title: UBS Fined $12 Million Over Short-Selling
description: 3:00 p.m. | Updated

title: F.T.C.: 28 Pay-for-Delay Generic Drug Deals
description: Updated: 5:30 p.m. Drug companies negotiated 28 potential pay-for-delay deals that slowed the marketing of cheaper generic drugs in the fiscal year ending Sept. 30, the Federal Trade Commission said Tuesday in a staff report.

title: Chris Cipollone, Citing Low Pay, Leaves Tenpenny for a New Job
description: Chris Cipollone, the chef at Tenpenny  in the Gotham Hotel in Midtown, has left.

title: Vain Glorious | Halloween Makeup
description: Halloween is nigh, and the big question for those who dare to dress up is should one go pretty or ghoulish? This year, Lydia Hearst is going to be a scary zombie, the D.J. Chelsea Leyland is going as a hot and sexy black swan and Katrina Bowden (30 Rock) will be a pretty Tinker Bell. Stylists are expecting requests for ever-glamorous Veronica Lake Hollywood curls, period finger waves and messy Amy Winehouse beehives.

title: #OccupyWallSt Roundup, Day 39
description: A Pew survey found that 39 percent of Americans support Occupy Wall Street, slightly higher than the number who oppose it, and that a higher number  44 percent  oppose the Tea Party. [Pew Research Center]

title: The Monograms Meet: O Sits Down With RL
description: Oprah Winfrey interviews Ralph Lauren, in front of a celebrity audience.

title: O and RL: Monograms Meet
description: THERE was no time allotted for audience questions during An Evening With Ralph Lauren.

title: Two and a Half Men Bounces Back
description: After enduring a month of steep drops following its huge season-premiere numbers, Two and a Half Men on CBS finally changed course on Monday night, reaching 15.4 million total viewers and posting a 6 percent increase in the 18-to-49-year-old demographic compared to last week. ABC had the most viewers for the night over all thanks to Dancing With the Stars, which averaged nearly 17 million total viewers over two hours.

title: Epstein Takes Over Cubs, With Another Streak to End
description: CHICAGO  Without playing an inning, Theo Epstein rose to a level approaching Ted Williams and Carl Yastrzemski as a Boston baseball hero after delivering two World Series titles in nine years as general manager of the formerly luckless, supposedly cursed Red Sox.

title: Photo Replay: Oct. 25
description: A view of the day in sports includes the strain of weightlifting, cricket celebration and an early Olympic peek.

title: Tempers Flare as European Meeting Nears
description: PARIS  Europeans may be on edge about Wednesdays summit meeting in Brussels on the euro crisis, but so are their leaders and their tempers.

title: Bay Areas Big Names Come Out for Mayor Lee
description: Every now and then in politics, you come across something you just have to watch, and this is one of them.

title: LENS:BANKERS
description: LENS:BANKERS

title: Help Wanted? Debating Unemployment Legislation
description: Overview | How is unemployment affecting the United States? What can be done to address the high rate of joblessness? Which steps should the federal government take, and which should it avoid? In this lesson, students explore arguments for and against the enactment of proposed legislation and hold a debate.

title: Too Legit to Watch
description: Heres a dose of politics, Silicon Valley style. Two investors, Ron Conway and Sean Parker, have teamed up to finance a promotional video for a San Francisco mayoral candidate, Ed Lee, reports TechCrunch. The two-minute video, a remake of M.C. Hammers 1991 song Too Legit to Quit, stars Twitters co-founder, Biz Stone; a Google executive, Marissa Mayer; Will.i.am of the Black Eyed Peas; and yes, Mr. Hammer. Read more

title: Wind, Sand and Starlings at Yanaba Island
description: Jack Dumbacher, curator of ornithology and mammalogy at the California Academy of Sciences, writes from Milne Bay, Papua New Guinea, where he is studying island birds and their diseases.

title: Quaintness Tucked Between Brooklyn Housing Projects
description: New York is famously a city of contrasts: old frame houses butt up against new construction, ethnicities commingle on the subway, the moneyed live in view of the poor. This week the Appraisal takes stock of a Brooklyn street where this is particularly true: Warren between Nevins and Bond in Boerum Hill, where town houses are bookended by two public housing projects in a neighborhood where property values have risen sharply over the years.

title: Spooky Sketches | Ports 1961
description: T challenges 10 designers to turn everyday objects into killer Halloween costumes.

title: U.S. Parts Smuggled to Iran for Iraq Bombs, Charges Say
description: WASHINGTON  Electronic parts made in Minnesota were smuggled through Singapore to Iran, and some of them ended up in the remote controls of makeshift bombs seized by American forces in Iraq, the Justice Department said on Tuesday.

title: Are Apps for 3-Year-Olds Really Educational?
description: Is it delusional to think that apps for very young children are really educational?

title: Netflix Market Value Shrivels
description: In July, Netflixs market value was over $16 billion. On Tuesday, after a bruising response to the financial results the company released late Monday, the Internet movie company lost more than $2 billion in value, bringing its total market capitalization to just over $4 billion.

title: TimesCast |October 25, 2011
description: New York City police officers are arrested for smuggling guns; European Union finance ministers abruptly cancel their meeting; and the Op-Ed columnist Nicholas D. Kristof on Tunisia's Islamic party.

title: Broadway Recruits Nick Jonas to Boost Kids Night Attendance
description: To help increase ticket sales for its annual Kids Night on Broadway, New York theater owners and producers have recruited a former Broadway kid himself, pop idol Nick Jonas, as the 2012 spokesman for the five-day program in February. The 19-year-old Mr. Jonas appeared on Broadway as a boy in Les Misrables, Beauty and the Beast and Annie Get Your Gun before achieving pinup status as a member of the Jonas Brothers band, and on Jan. 24 he will take over the lead role of J. Pierrepont Finch in the Broadway revival of How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying.

title: Eric Asimov Is the Interim Restaurant Critic
description: While we wait for the puffs of white smoke that will issue from the chimney atop 620 Eighth Avenue when The Times names its next restaurant critic, the weekly reviews will be written by Eric Asimov. This week he takes on Salinas, in Chelsea, which is worth two stars in his book.

title: Spain Without the Hocus-Pocus
description: EVER since the center of culinary innovation shifted to Spain with the ascent of El Bulli and other like-minded restaurants, New York has been awaiting its own specimen of contemporary Spanish gastronomy. For some reason, it hasnt happened, at least, not entirely successfully.

title: Reviewing Salinas
description: Yes, Ive got myself some temp work here as the process of selecting the next restaurant critic unfolds. This week, Im reviewing Salinas, one of a series of good Spanish restaurants to have opened in recent years.

title: Flood Waters Free Crocodiles in Thailand
description: First it was Bengal tigers in Ohio. Now its crocodiles in Bangkok that have broken loose and are menacing the local population.

title: I.B.M. Names Virginia Rometty as New Chief Executive
description: Virginia M. Rometty, a senior vice president at I.B.M., will be the companys next chief executive, the directors announced on Tuesday. She will succeed Samuel J. Palmisano, 60, who will remain as chairman, at the start of next year.

title: Uniqlo Alights on Fifth Avenue
description: THERE may be nothing new under the sun, but does this excuse fashion designers endless plunder of the past and what the late raconteur Quentin Crisp once dismissed, with an audible curl of the lip, as decade-ism? This season, the 1970s are back, as they have been repeatedly since the 90s; in the 70s people were wild for the 30s, so if you participate in what some are calling a 90s revival, you are in fact piling on more than 50 years of influences and references. It seems rather ... bloated, doesnt it?

title: Even Against Series, Viewers Flock to the N.F.L.
description: 6:15 p.m. | Updated If Major League Baseball truly wants to make an argument about still being Americas pastime after this years World Series, it will need some real voodoo mathematics.

title: An Influence And Songs That Grow On You
description: The music of Kenny Wheeler doesnt really clamor for attention. Mr. Wheeler, a quietly influential jazz trumpeter originally from Canada but living in Britain for nearly 60 years, favors graceful melody and intuitive harmony, avoiding the trappings of needless flourish and easy friction. His songs  for thats usually what they are, solid and hummable  tend to be meticulous in their construction but free of visible effort, in the manner of fine haberdashery or good industrial design.

title: This Time Didos Lament Streams Forth From a Burly Man
description: The countertenor voice is not necessarily something you want to hear in quantity. True, the ability to produce and project a falsetto sound of consistent quality is remarkable. But it is the rare countertenor who commands a wide variety of tone colors or, for that matter, even gets very far into the plural.

title: Congressman Objects to Chinese Diplomacy
description: Lawyers for the Justice Department have declared that President Obama has the constitutional power to override a statute forbidding members of the White House Office of Science and Technology Policy from engaging in activities with Chinese officials.

title: The Grand Concourse Gets Its Due
description: The city gave an Art Deco-filled stretch of the Grand Concourse in the Bronx  along with an artists housing complex in the West Village, a church-turned-synagogue-turned-theater in Brooklyn and a Staten Island cottage  landmark protection on Tuesday.

title: Its Still a Renters Market, Office Landlords Learn
description: Last February, Bloomberg L.P. signed a 400,000-square-foot lease at 120 Park Avenue. Wells Fargo had originally scouted the space, but Bloomberg offered a higher rent, making one of this years biggest office deals. It was a sign, commercial real estate brokers said, that the Manhattan office market was tilting in landlords favor again.

title: Amazon Suffers Big Drop in Income
description: Investors shrugged off Amazons warnings this summer that its third quarter would be weak.

title: 8 City Officers Charged in Gun Smuggling Case
description: Eight current and former New York police officers were arrested on Tuesday and charged in federal court with accepting thousands of dollars in cash to drive a caravan of firearms into the state, an act of corruption that brazenly defied the citys strenuous efforts to get illegal guns off the streets.

title: Romney Taps a Virginia Suburb for Cash
description: Mitt Romney is coming to Virginia on Wednesday for a pep talk at the Northern Virginia Republican headquarters.

title: Yemens Embattled Government Calls Cease-Fire That So Far Fails to End Violence
description: SANA, Yemen  The northern part of the capital city has turned into a virtual war zone in recent days, and even as the government announced a cease-fire on Tuesday, explosions boomed across the city.

title: A Rock Star, a Lawyer and a Hotel Hand Walk Into a Magazine
description: Now we are copy editors, designers, researchers, editorial assistants, photo editors. But some people at this magazine led strange past lives. One was an indie-rock bassist, one was a lawyer, another was a Canadian.  Now Mark van de Walle, a researcher here, has written about his past life as a hotel hand/amanuensis at the Paris Review:

title: Pictures of the Day: Turkey and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Turkey, Thailand, Libya and Tunisia.

title: Tenth Tibetan Reported to Self-Immolate in Anti-China Protest
description: A Tibetan monk in western Chinas Sichuan province set himself on fire on Tuesday to express opposition to Chinas Tibet policies, becoming the 10th Tibetan this year to self-immolate as a form of political protest, an outside advocacy group reported.

title: Americans Approval of Congress Drops to Single Digits
description: Americans approval of Congress reach single digit for the first time in history.

title: Michael Laiskonis Will Be Moving on From Le Bernardin
description: Michael Laiskonis (shown), who has been the pastry chef at Le Bernardin for nearly eight years, will leave by Jan. 1 to pursue other ventures, including writing a book and teaching.

title: Look of The Moment | Camilla Belle
description: The Look: Deco Darling. A shocking pink lip, slicked hair and diamond chandelier earrings are natural pairings for a beaded evening dress inspired by Art Deco architecture.

title: Off the Menu
description: Opening

title: Dining Calendar
description: Satire for Foodies

title: Pictures of the Day: Turkey and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Turkey, Thailand, Libya and Tunisia.

title: 3 Aid Workers Kidnapped in Somalia
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  An American aid worker and two colleagues were kidnapped by Somali gunmen Tuesday in the Somali region of Puntland, a Danish organization said.

title: Channel Surfing: Flip Men vs. Ratholes
description: Anyone who has roamed through televisions renovating/make-overing/house-flipping genre probably has been struck with the notion that the most appropriate tool for attacking some of the featured projects is a bulldozer. That is certainly a likely response to the opening episode of Flip Men, Tuesday night on Spike. When you have to rip as much out of a house as ends up being ripped out here, maybe you should have just torn the danged thing down.

title: For Romney, an Awkward Visit
description: On Issues 2 and 3, Mitt Romney had zero to say.

title: The Biggest Losers: MF Global and Netflix
description: There is little MF Global and Netflix have in common, except for the fact that the stocks of both companies plunged on Tuesday after a spate of bad news.

title: My Trip to Madison: Bikes, Brews, Burgers and a B&B
description: What a great idea  if only I had thought of it: take a trip to Madison, Wis.; stay in a cozy bed- and-breakfast; get around by bike; test out burgers, brats, cheese curds and microbrews; and look for some booze to bring back home.

title: Zoe Caldwell to Star On Upper East Side
description: Zoe Caldwell would like to invite you for tea and sandwiches. Figuratively and literally. The four-time Tony Award-winner is set to star in David Adjmis new play, Elective Affinities, directed by Soho Reps artistic director, Sarah Benson. The twist is that the site-specific production will take place in an Upper East Side town house that will hold a maximum of 30 people each evening, with Ms. Caldwells character, Alice Hauptmann, playing the role of host. Advance tickets sold out in less than 24 hours. (A limited number of tickets, however, may be made available on the day of each performance.) I was sent from the Soho Rep a play, a one-woman play, and I said Oh no no, Ms. Caldwell said in a telephone interview. I did Lillian  a 1986 play about Lillian Hellman  and that almost did me in. She added, Then Charlie, my son, said, You could at least read the script before you dismiss it. And I said, Fair enough. Mr. Adjmi, best known as the author of Stunning, won a 2010 Whiting Award for playwriting. I was so stunned by the writing which is marvelously exact, Ms. Caldwell said of Elective Affinities, which was commissioned by the Royal Court Theater and produced by the Royal Shakespeare Company in 2005. The producers of the American premiere are Soho Rep, piece by piece productions and Rising Phoenix Repertory. It is scheduled to run Nov. 17 to Dec. 18.

title: Robust Voices, Celebrated on a Small Stage
description: A CD release party at Le Poisson Rouge is fast becoming almost standard practice among classical musicians, a way of promoting a disc and offering a live performance of excerpts in an entertaining, low-key setting.

title: Is It Art, Science or a Test of People?
description: Over the past several years art museums have begun to place much more emphasis on a concept they call the visitor experience. Few, though, have attempted to define that concept quite as broadly  or as bodily  as the New Museum, which is mounting a career survey of the Belgian-born artist Carsten Hller that opens on Wednesday.

title: Their Year of Living Almost Famously
description: WASHINGTON  It has been a heady year for John Paul White and Joy Williams, who together are the folk-pop duo called the Civil Wars.

title: Desdemona Talks Back to Othello
description: NANTERRE, France  A decade ago Toni Morrison, the Nobel Prize-winning novelist, and Peter Sellars, the experimental theater and opera director, got into a fierce argument about Shakespeares Othello. He said it was a terrible play that made no sense and had outlived its usefulness. She said he was dead wrong.

title: The Dance World Turns Out to Honor Its Own
description: This year the Bessies moved uptown. On Monday the New York Dance and Performance Awards, named after the highly influential teacher and mentor Bessie Schonberg, were given out at the Apollo Theater in Harlem.

title: Whiting Foundation Names Winners of Writers Awards
description: The winners of the Whiting Writers Awards, given annually to authors of exceptional talent and promise in early career, were announced on Tuesday. The 2011 recipients include the fiction writers Scott Blackwood (We Agreed to Meet Just Here), Teddy Wayne (Kapitoil), Daniel Orozco (Orientation) and Ryan Call (The Weather Stations).

title: Recreating The Chants Of Feisty 1200s Nuns
description: The boundless array of restrictions imposed on women over the centuries has included a ban on their singing polyphonic music in the Middle Ages. But it is thought that the nuns in Las Huelgas, a Cistercian convent for noblewomen in north-central Spain, enthusiastically flouted the rule. Indeed, the medieval abbesses at Las Huelgas could even say Mass and hear confessions, privileges revoked by the 19th century.

title: Hawaiis Traditions, Retold in Words and Movement
description: MONTCLAIR, N.J.  Montclair State Universitys Peak Performances series has a reputation for presenting avant-garde dance, frequently imported from abroad and for some reason unavailable in New York. What took the stage of the Alexander Kasser Theater on Thursday, however, was more like a holiday pageant suitable for a high school auditorium. Diorama groupings, a mismatch between mythic subject matter and amateur performances, even a skittish narrator giving a halting reading of stilted text  it was all there. Plus the hula.

title: Obama to Michelle: More Candy on Halloween
description: LOS ANGELES  President Obama poked fun at Republicans and even his wife, Michelle, during a taped appearance on Tuesday on NBCs The Tonight Show, cracking up the host Jay Leno if not his spouse.

title: Feeling the Long Reach of Jack the Ripper in a Series of Gruesome Killings
description: An awful lot of copycatting is going on in Whitechapel, a six-part crime series starting on BBC America on Wednesday night, and only some of it is by the killer being pursued.

title: Banks May Be Target of Their Own Tactic: Advocating a Breakup
description: Perhaps it is not Occupy Wall Street that the banks should fear, but their latest frothy financial product. Investment bankers are crisscrossing the nation peddling spinoffs. But given the weak stock prices of these banks, they may find themselves under the same pressure to split up from their own investors.

title: Giving Sweet Home Alabama a Polish Accent
description: Jimmy Sturr has been at this awhile. The way he snatches the microphone from its stand and yanks it up to his mouth, the ever so slight crouch in his stance when hes trying to communicate a point, the gleam that appears to emanate from him onstage: all products of four-plus decades of work at keeping polka alive.

title: Scaling Bachs Mountains With Stamina and Skill
description: By refusing to specialize in a particular corner of the violin repertory, and leaping freely among several, Jennifer Koh has built a following that draws on, and ideally brings together, several of the music worlds style-conscious enclaves. Some listeners know her for the hard-edged contemporary scores she has recorded and to which she has devoted full recitals. Others associate her with the six free lunchtime recitals of Bachs Unaccompanied Sonatas and Partitas (BWV 1001-6) she gave at Columbia University two seasons ago. She is also touring with a Bach and Beyond series in which she juxtaposes the solo Bach works with 20th- and 21st-century pieces, some written for the occasion.

title: Eating Like a Rock Star at Emilios Ballato
description: An unassuming Italian restaurant on East Houston Street attracts some very famous patrons.

title: Like Raos, but You Can Get In
description: ONE afternoon back in February, Scott Conant was feeling grumpy and hungry. Mr. Conant, the chef at Scarpetta, has a business office in SoHo, and he was curious about a restaurant a short walk away that a friend had recommended.

title: TimesCast | Gun Smuggling Accusations
description: October 25, 2011 - Eight current and former New York Police Department officers were arrested for gun trafficking and smuggling cigarettes.

title: 3 Arrested in Killing of Woman Near School
description: Three days after a 34-year-old woman was killed by gunfire in Brooklyn as she picked up her child after school, detectives arrested the suspected gunman, his brother and a half-brother, the police said Tuesday.

title: TimesCast | Euro Debt Deal in Flux
description: October 25, 2011 - European Union finance ministers abruptly cancel a Wednesday meeting, causing stock markets in the United States and Europe to drop along with the euro.

title: New Red Sox G.M. Pledges Only Minor Changes
description: BOSTON  The Red Sox figured they had good news to impart Tuesday with the announcement that Ben Cherington would succeed Theo Epstein as the teams general manager.

title: Bottle of Red, Bottle of White at Emilios Ballato
description: When the guy who wrote Scenes from an Italian Restaurant tells you to try an Italian restaurant, it seems sensible to pay attention.

title: 2 European Banks Post Mixed Results
description: FRANKFURT  As European officials struggle to find a solution to the sovereign debt crisis, two of the regions largest financial firms continue to deal with the fallout from the market turmoil.

title: Volvo Adjusts to Life With a Rich, Quiet Benefactor
description: GOTHENBURG, Sweden  Between Swedens two main carmakers, as I reported in The Times on Tuesday, Saab Automobile has hit hard times, while Volvo Cars appears to be going great guns.

title: Table Dressing
description: Two great tastes dont always taste great together. The same can be true for design collaborations. Heath Ceramics are beautiful. Alabama Chanin textiles are beautiful. Their respective designers, Catherine Bailey and Natalie Chanin, are friends. But could the twain meet?

title: Battle for Libya | October 25, 2011
description: The aftermath of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafis death and the end of the revolution in Libya.

title: Mozzarella as Medium and Muse
description: BREAKFAST meetings, perhaps, are best suited to Hollywood types, people who pitch and spin even before the first coffee. When I found myself in San Francisco early this month along with Nancy Silverton, the esteemed founder of La Brea Bakery and the restaurant Campanile in Los Angeles, the only time we could get together was for breakfast. Ms. Silverton, who now owns two of Los Angeless most popular restaurants, Osteria Mozza and Pizzeria Mozza, with Mario Batali and Joe Bastianich, has just published her eighth book, The Mozza Cookbook (Alfred A. Knopf, $35), and she suggested Boulettes Larder, in the Ferry Building.

title: Q&A: A Wi-Fi Tablet in a 3G World
description: Q. I have an Android tablet that can connect to the Internet only through Wi-Fi. Can I get a 3G chip for it to use the phone data networks too?

title: Talking About Sex, in Class and at Home
description: To the Editor:

title: Cookies From Casablanca, Now in New York
description: Steve Blanco, a jazz pianist whose mother is from Casablanca, Morocco, grew up eating crumbly, shortbread-style cookies that are called ghoribas in North Africa. About a year ago he and his girlfriend and partner, Heidi Karlsen, who has baked professionally, decided to try making them with notable tweaks, like replacing semolina with rye flour and butter or cooking oil with coconut oil. They call them Sandcastles. So far they have perfected two rich, nutty flavors: marzipan and black sesame. Next in line are maple-dusted cardamom and poppy-seed-lemon.

title: Raclette Made Simple
description: In its traditional Alpine home, raclette can involve rigmarole  lighting a fire (preferably in your ski lodge), holding a hunk of the cheese before the flames and scraping off what melts to serve with boiled potatoes and pickles. But you can simply melt some nuggets of Spring Brook Farms raclette from Vermont in a saucepan, and its just about as good. This mild yet complex cows-milk cheese has an earthy aroma and fruity flavor. It comes in big wheels with rust-colored rind enclosing a satiny, semisoft paste. As superb as it is for melting (burgers, pasta, soup, sandwiches), it is also excellent on a cheese tray. And its educational; Spring Brook is a host of the Farms for City Kids program, bringing fourth and fifth graders from urban schools to milk cows and do chores.

title: Look Out: Patrik Ervell at Work
description: The Patrik Ervell pop-up at Boffo Building Fashion at 57 Walker Street looks more like a construction site than a high-end designer shop.

title: How the Poll Was Conducted
description: The latest New York Times/CBS News Poll is based on telephone interviews conducted Oct. 19 through Oct. 24 with 1,650 adults throughout the United States. Of these, 1,475 said they were registered to vote.

title: New Poll Finds a Deep Distrust of Government
description: With Election Day just over a year away, a deep sense of economic anxiety and doubt about the future hangs over the nation, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News poll, with Americans distrust of government at its highest level ever.

title: Manhattan? BASF Prefers the Countryside
description: When BASF, the worlds largest chemical company, was looking for a new North American headquarters, opportunity was just around the corner.

title: Battle for Libya | October 24, 2011
description: People lined up to see Col. Muammar el-Qaddafis body, lying on a mattress in a meat locker.

title: Small Wonders
description: THE unshaven guy working the mini-cannoli booth in Madison Square Park glanced from side to side, making sure the vendors next door were busy with their samosas and shaved ice.

title: Journalist Describes Captivity in Syria
description: Sean McAllister, a British documentary filmmaker, was arrested in the Syrian capital, Damascus, last week while working secretly for Britains Channel 4 News. In an interview broadcast on Tuesday, after his release, Mr. McAllister described his captivity, and the torture of detained activists he overheard from his cell.

title: Female Genital Cutting
description: To the Editor:

title: 3 More San Francisco Restaurants Gain 2 Michelin Stars
description: 7:25 p.m. |Update

title: 1 Arrested in Zuccotti Park Death Threat
description: 2:20 a.m. | Updated Two days after a man accused of assaulting three female protesters in Zuccotti Park was arrested, some friends of his threatened to kill the woman who had filed the complaint that led to the arrest, the police said on Tuesday.

title: New York Times Poll on the Republican Primary and Economy
description: Complete results of the New York Times/CBS News Poll, Oct. 19-24.

title: Martha Stewart Revisits Entertaining, 70 Books Later
description: In 1982, the book was Entertaining by Martha Stewart. Now, with a media empire, television exposure, more than 70 books and a sky-high profile, her latest book is Marthas Entertaining: A Year of Celebrations (Clarkson Potter, $75).

title: Reviewing Blueprint, the Cannibal and Wild Rise
description: A look at three new places serving ambitious bar food.

title: When a Neurosis Is Part of the Attraction
description: Urban alienation and cyberdependence are the twin supports of Sidewalls, a whimsical romantic comedy from the Argentine director Gustavo Taretto.

title: The Energy Map
description: Rising energy demand in emerging economies, like China and India, is a driving force in the natural gas and oil industry and is helping to push prices higher. At the same time, technological advances are making the recovery of more conventional and unconventional resources feasible, reshaping the energy landscape around the world.

title: A Toast to a New Breed of Bar Food
description: IT used to be that when you went to a bar, you got a free bowl of peanuts. Now the drinking has become a whole lot more interesting, and interest leads to commitment. Bar food is flirting with seriousness, tempting you to stay in your seat all night.

title: Edwards Fights Campaign Finance Case
description: GREENSBORO, N.C.  Lawyers for John Edwards will head to federal court here on Wednesday to ask a judge to dismiss charges that he violated campaign finance laws by using money from two wealthy benefactors to support his pregnant mistress during his run for the presidency in 2008.

title: John McCarthy, 84, Dies; Computer Design Pioneer
description: John McCarthy, a computer scientist who helped design the foundation of todays Internet-based computing and who is widely credited with coining the term for a frontier of research he helped pioneer, Artificial Intelligence, or A.I., died on Monday at his home in Stanford, Calif. He was 84.

title: New Technologies Redraw the Worlds Energy Picture
description: GOLDA MEIR, the former prime minister of Israel, used to tell a joke about how Moses must have made a wrong turn in the desert: He dragged us 40 years through the desert to bring us to the one place in the Middle East where there was no oil.

title: E.R. Care and Abortion: A G.O.P. Congressmans View
description: To the Editor:

title: A New Generation of Unconventional Fossil Fuels
description: Giant new oil and gas fields are being mined, steamed and drilled with new technologies.

title: Egyptian Activists Summoned by Military Prosecutor
description: Updated | Thursday, 2:20 p.m. An Egyptian military prosecutor summoned two activists for interrogation on Monday, the same day President Obama urged the head of Egypts ruling military council to end military trials for civilians in a phone call from the White House.

title: On the Front Lines of the Power Grid
description: QUICK! You are on duty in a secret control room in a nondescript, windowless building. The sign out front is so small that people driving by cannot read it, and it may give no clue what goes on inside, anyway. But your task is crucial: you are matching the ever-changing power needs of tens of millions of electricity customers with supply coming from hundreds of electricity generators, deciding which units will run and which ones will be idle, and making quick adjustments for the generators you cant schedule, like the wind machines and solar panels.

title: Solar Power Industry Falls Short of Hopes in Job Creation
description: GOVERNMENT help for solar power was supposed to be a triple play: jobs at a time of dire short-term need; incubation of an American industry sure to be important on a global scale in the next few years; and a long-term reduction in climate-changing pollution.

title: To Inspect Live Utility Lines, Send In the Robots
description: VARENNES, Quebec

title: In Clean Tech, Venture Capital Looks for Problem-Solvers
description: SAN FRANCISCO

title: Future of Solar and Wind Power May Hinge on Federal Aid
description: AUSTIN, Tex.

title: The Sports Industry Curbs Its Energy Use
description: Team owners and event organizers are cutting their energy consumption to save money, and they are generating new income measures by teaming up with corporate sponsors to go green.

title: Sports Rally Around Green Projects
description: AMERICAN sports are often an exercise in excess: fans consume large quantities of beer and hot dogs, stadiums with giant scoreboards and retractable roofs are surrounded by parking lots filled with thousands of cars. In many ways, they represent the broadest cross-section of consumer culture and Americas wasteful ways.

title: Define Fair Share in Taxes
description: To the Editor:

title: The Athletes Strike Back
description: William C. Rhoden discusses the latest clashes between athletes and the media.

title: Military Drills Paired With Shrimp? For a Prince, Its Possible
description: GILA BEND, Ariz.  Among the books mentioning princes in the Gila Bend Branch Library is The Prince and the Potty, about a young prince learning to outgrow his diaper, and The Frog Prince Continued, about a frog who was turned into a prince but kept hopping on furniture and flicking his tongue at flies.

title: Video: The Athletes Strike Back
description: William C. Rhoden discusses the latest clashes between athletes and the media.

title: U.S. Expected to Charge Executive Tied to Galleon Case
description: 9:02 p.m. | Updated

title: Excerpt: 'Sledgehammer'
description: A scene from Sledgehammer, a 1983 movie that was released this year on VHS. (Video courtesy of Intervision.)

title: How Rick Perrys Tax Plan Would Affect You
description: Gov. Rick Perry of Texas, who is seeking the Republican presidential nomination, today released some details on his flat tax proposal. The plan would give Americans the option of determining their taxes based on an alternate system that has one tax rate and fewer deductions.

title: Congress Wants Hearing on H.G.H. Testing in N.F.L.
description: Three members of Congress called Tuesday for a hearing on the delay in beginning testing for human growth hormone in the N.F.L.

title: Insurer Drops Fight to Keep Rate Filings From Public
description: The largest health insurer in New York, United Health/Oxford, has agreed to drop a fight to keep its filings for rate increases secret, putting pressure on other insurance carriers to follow suit rather than keep battling against state regulators pressing for disclosure.

title: The Shot Heard Round Brooklyn
description: Perhaps its the amateur historian in me, but I gravitate to people who have experienced first-hand things I wish I had, too. Bobby Thomsons game-ending home run that won the 1951 National League pennant for the New York Giants  and made a goat out of Ralph Branca of the Brooklyn Dodgers  is one of those experiences.

title: Ketchup Moves Upmarket, With a Balsamic Tinge
description: TO emphasize its thickness, Heinz ketchup introduced a series of commercials in the 1970s that featured Anticipation, the Carly Simon song, which played as actors waited longingly for ketchup to pour onto burgers and fries.

title: That 2011-12 N.B.A. Schedule? Never Mind
description: More N.B.A. games will be canceled soon, perhaps today or tomorrow or next week. The timing hardly matters anymore. The schedule, at least as it was presented in July, is already worthless.

title: Luthiers: The Latest Endangered Species
description: New Haven

title: Left-Footed Penalty Takers Showing the Way in M.L.S.
description: Fox Soccer analyst Warren Barton shared a peculiar thought on air last February shortly after Everton had ousted Chelsea from the F.A. Cup on penalties at Stamford Bridge.

title: Sprints Hand in Antitrust Suit
SAT Officials Vow More Security After Cheating Arrests on Long Island
description: FARMINGDALE, N.Y.  Stung by the arrest of seven Long Island teenagers accused of cheating on the SAT, the College Board said Tuesday that it was hiring a former F.B.I. director to review its security procedures, and that by the next exams, Nov. 5, it would begin analyzing more test scores for irregularities and increase training for test-center supervisors.

title: China Takes a Loss to Get Ahead in the Business of Fresh Water
description: TIANJIN, China  Towering over the Bohai Sea shoreline on this citys outskirts, the Beijiang Power and Desalination Plant is a 26-billion-renminbi technical marvel: an ultrahigh-temperature, coal-fired generator with state-of-the-art pollution controls, mated to advanced Israeli equipment that uses its leftover heat to distill seawater into fresh water.

title: Report Lays Out States Great Gains and Losses From Globalization
description: As international trade has accelerated in the last four decades, no state has lost more of its ability to make things or gained more through exporting ideas and professional services than New York has, according to a report to be released on Wednesday.

title: Food Blooms in the Desert
description: Last month, I stood in the midday sun a few miles north of Anthony, N. M., and Anthony, Tex.  a town divided by the state line created in 1854  staring out over a 15-acre plot of land that didnt look like much. In this part of the world, it was once almost as easy to travel from the United States to Mexico and back as it is to go from one Anthony to another. Now the trip can drive you crazy, with long waits and inspections; if youre undocumented and unlucky, it can kill you.

title: Top Earners Doubled Share of Nations Income, Study Finds
description: WASHINGTON  The top 1 percent of earners more than doubled their share of the nations income over the last three decades, the Congressional Budget Office said Tuesday, in a new report likely to figure prominently in the escalating political fight over how to revive the economy, create jobs and lower the federal debt.

title: The Hague: Four Prosecutor Finalists
description: A committee on Tuesday announced its list of four final candidates to become the chief prosecutor for the International Criminal Court: Fatou Bensouda of Gambia, Andrew Cayley of Britain, Mohamed Chande Othman of Tanzania and Robert Petit of Canada. The prosecutor is expected to be chosen in December to replace Luis Moreno-Ocampo of Argentina. Mrs. Bensouda is widely considered to be the front-runner.

title: President to Ease Student Loan Burden for Low-Income Graduates
description: President Obama will announce new programs Wednesday to lower monthly loan payments for some students graduating next year and thereafter and to let borrowers who have a mix of direct federal loans and loans under the old Federal Family Education Loan Program consolidate them at a slightly lower interest rate.

title: Baseballs Game of Telephone
description: ST. LOUIS  In Atlanta, there are televisions in the dugouts to help the manager monitor the action in his teams bullpen  who is warming up, and how ready a pitcher might be to enter the game.

title: Uganda: Anti-Gay Bill Is Revived
description: Parliament has voted to reopen a debate on a bill that seeks to outlaw homosexuality and that could be expanded to include the death penalty for gay men and lesbians. The legislation, first proposed in 2009, will be sent to a committee for consideration, Speaker Rebecca Kadaga told lawmakers. The Legal and Parliamentary Affairs Committee in the previous Parliament suggested that the penalty for aggravated homosexuality should be the same as for defilement, a crime that is punishable by death.

title: Pakistan: Judge Wounded by Gunman
description: An unidentified gunman wounded the chief justice of the high court in the Pakistani-controlled part of the disputed Kashmir region on Tuesday, the police said. The justice, Ghulam Mustafa Mughal, was shot in the abdomen and taken to a military hospital, where his condition was said to be stable. The gunman was not caught, and the motive for the attack was unclear. Kashmir is claimed by both India and Pakistan, and the attack occurred after death threats were made to another Pakistani judge, who had sentenced the killer of the Punjab Province governor.

title: Its Consumer Spending, Stupid
description: AS an economic historian who has been studying American capitalism for 35 years, Im going to let you in on the best-kept secret of the last century: private investment  that is, using business profits to increase productivity and output  doesnt actually drive economic growth. Consumer debt and government spending do. Private investment isnt even necessary to promote growth.

title: Telemundo Blends English Into a Mostly Spanish Lineup
description: Telemundo has long trailed its rival Univision in their competition for Hispanic television viewers in the United States. But as the number of second- and third-generation Hispanic-Americans skyrockets, the perennial runner-up is embracing a new strategy  English-language subtitles and Spanglish  to attract deep-pocketed viewers and the advertisers who covet them.

title: Will Extremists Hijack Occupy Wall Street?
description: THE activists of Occupy Wall Street have already scored a stunning  and I think welcome  success.

title: A Sky-High Tide, This Time Fleeting, but Perhaps a Glimpse of Torrents to Come
description: From his window in Broad Channel, Queens, Dan Mundy sees the tides of Jamaica Bay swing from high to low, the pendulum of a celestial clock. Right now, 10 after 1 in the afternoon, it is 25 minutes from dead-low tide, he said on Tuesday. Its much lower now than it would usually be. The mud flats are bigger.

title: Nusrat Bhutto, Political Force in Pakistan, Dies at 82
description: Nusrat Bhutto, a near-mythic figure in Pakistans modern history, whose husband, Zulfikar Ali Bhutto, was executed in 1979 after being deposed as prime minister in a military coup, and whose daughter Benazir Bhutto, a former prime minister, was killed by a suicide bomber while campaigning for office in 2007, died Sunday in Dubai. She was 82.

title: Barack Kissinger Obama
description: Who would have predicted it? Barack Obama has turned out to be so much more adept at implementing George W. Bushs foreign policy than Bush was, but he is less adept at implementing his own. The reasons, though, are obvious.

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 4,472 American service members who have died since the start of the Iraq war and 1,804 who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the deaths of the following Americans recently:

title: In Chicago, Michelle Obama Takes On Food Deserts
description: CHICAGO  Michelle Obama took an afternoon away from fund-raising for her husbands re-election campaign on Tuesday to draw attention to another  and far less divisive  goal: reducing childhood obesity.

title: Moving Beyond the Cold War Coach
description: Youth sports in the United States is a contradiction. In surveys, parents overwhelmingly say that youth sports should emphasize values like teamwork, honesty, discipline and fair play. But when adults are asked what values they think youth sports actually reinforce most, they say competitiveness and the importance of winning.

title: How to Fix the Wireless Market
description: Its good that wireless companies have agreed to warn customers when they are about to exceed monthly limits on voice, text or data usage or incur international roaming fees, which can result in thousands of dollars of extra charges. But consumers need more protection.

title: A Foolish Time to Cut Housing Aid
description: With record numbers of families teetering on the verge of homelessness, Congress should be shoring up the precious few federal programs that provide affordable housing for the poor, the elderly and the disabled. Instead, both the House and Senate are considering cuts to the Department of Housing and Urban Development budget, which would hurt cash-strapped states and communities in sheltering the most vulnerable citizens.

title: Europe Faces New Hurdles in Crisis Over Debt
description: PARIS  New fissures and disagreements emerged on Tuesday on the eve of a European Union summit meeting promoted as the moment for agreement on a comprehensive solution to the two-year-old euro crisis. Crucial financial measures were left unresolved, and Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi of Italy faced strong opposition inside his governing coalition to major changes demanded by the Europeans.

title: So Much for Small Government
description: House Republicans usually claim to be champions of both small government and states rights, which makes it hypocritical, and downright reckless, that they are obsessed with taking away the authority of states to decide who is allowed to carry a concealed and loaded handgun.

title: In Shifting Landscape, UConn Loses Ground
description: STORRS, Conn.  In the lobby of the University of Connecticuts football facility, there is a trophy case that displays mementos from the teams trip to the Fiesta Bowl last season. Among the items are a football with the games date on it, a game-day program and a plaque.

title: Why Has the Black Death Paled?
description: Could there be a better pretext for a disaster movie? Scientists from McMaster University in Ontario and the University of Tbingen in Germany have reconstructed the genetic code of the microbe that caused the Black Death.

title: Tvez Situation Takes Another Odd Turn
description: The news that Manchester City has fined its sulking striker Carlos Tvez a months pay and sentenced him, essentially, to time served as a punishment would seem to put to rest the controversy that has been a rare stain on the clubs solid start to the Premier League season.

title: A Leading Pioneer
description: NEW LONDON, Conn.  Except for a strategic bit of elastic that may be required, the blue running tunic, circa Smith College 1961, still fits. It will be worn again a half-century later, this time in celebration and tribute rather than defiance.

title: One Day After Disaster, Manager Explains Himself
description: ST. LOUIS  He has won two World Series, been a subject of books about his managerial prowess and is considered by some as one of the best managers in baseball history. But on his way to what will undoubtedly be a Hall of Fame induction, Tony La Russa, a manager for 33 years, stumbled Monday night.

title: Perry Makes Digs at Romney on Fox News
description: Gov. Rick Perry of Texas capped an eventful day on the campaign trail Tuesday with an interview on The OReilly Factor on the Fox News Channel. He expressed regret for participating in campaign debates, which have largely resulted in poor reviews for him. And yet again, he came in tongue a-blazin, this time with some choice digs at his chief rival, former Gov. Mitt Romney of Massachusetts.

title: Limits of Magical Thinking
description: Steve Jobs, the mad perfectionist, even perfected his stare.

title: Tunisia Liberals See a Vote for Change, Not Religion
description: TUNIS  The liberal political parties emerging as surprise runners-up in elections here argued Tuesday that their success had tempered the commanding victory of the Islamists while offering lessons for their secular allies around the region.

title: Rick Perrys Tax and Spending Plan
description: Rick Perry wants to cap spending at 18 percent of G.D.P., the lowest rate since 1966.

title: In Case of Rain, a Case for Carpenter
description: ST. LOUIS  With a 90 percent chance of rain predicted for Wednesday, there is a possibility that Game 6 of the World Series at Busch Stadium could be rained out. If so, it might provide the St. Louis Cardinals with the opportunity to bring their ace, Chris Carpenter, back on short rest for a potential Game 7 on Friday.

title: Wednesday: Exhibited Perfect Braking
description: WEDNESDAYS PUZZLE  Sorry about the title. The Girl is learning to drive, and braking seems to be very much on our minds these days. That, and parallel parking, as well as not taking turns on two wheels. I will get through this, but Im pretty sure that this is the point in raising children where parents skip over other comforts and just turn directly to heroin.

title: Couple Who Took 8 Children From Foster Care Face Jail
description: A Manhattan couple who slipped their eight children out the back of a foster care agency in Queens and absconded with them for a week pleaded guilty on Tuesday to second-degree custodial interference.

title: Twitter and TV Get Close to Help Each Other Grow
description: Type the term X Factor into Twitters search engine on a Wednesday or Thursday night and within moments, hundreds of viewer compliments and complaints about the Fox television show of that name will appear.

title: DuPont Earnings Continue to Surpass Analysts Expectations
description: The DuPont Company, the top United States chemical maker, reported third-quarter profit and sales on Tuesday that beat analyst estimates, and then it raised its full-year forecast.

title: Lottery Numbers
New Increases in Tuition
description: Public higher-education institutions in California had the largest rise in tuition and fees between the 2010-11 and 2011-12 school years.

title: Special Parking Rules
description: On Wednesday, because of Diwali, the Hindu festival of lights, alternate-side street-cleaning regulations will be suspended in New York City. Other regulations will remain in effect.

title: Haitians Train for a Future With a Military
description: PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti  For hours, Robeson Arthiste dragged himself through the dirt like a commando, marched left, two, three, four, dived behind bushes pointing an imaginary gun and grimaced while a razor blade removed every bit of hair from his head, leaving a trickle of blood.

title: Islanders, Looking for a Win and Not a Fight, Get Neither
description: UNIONDALE, N.Y.  The Islanders apparently needed to win a game more than they needed to prove any more points with their fists Tuesday night, so the pugnacious left wing Trevor Gillies was scratched before they played the Pittsburgh Penguins at Nassau Coliseum.

title: Ex-Associate Testifies Against Reputed Arms Trafficker
description: In the friendly, informal e-mail exchanges exhibited in a Manhattan courtroom on Tuesday, Andrew Smulian wished Viktor Bout, a Russian reputed to be an arms trafficker, a happy birthday and bragged about the maturity of his own teenage son before signing off with a nickname, Axel.

title: Debating the Legal Start of Life
description: A constitutional amendment facing voters in Mississippi would declare a fertilized human egg to be a legal person, effectively branding abortion and some forms of birth control as murder.

title: As the Data Show, Theres a Reason the Wall Street Protesters Chose New York
description: When the federal income tax was first imposed in 1913, the richest 0.1 percent of households reaped 8.6 percent of the nations income. In 2007, as the recession began, the share going to that sliver of megarich Americans was 12.3 percent.

title: Push for Personhood Amendment Represents New Tack in Abortion Fight
description: A constitutional amendment facing voters in Mississippi on Nov. 8, and similar initiatives brewing in half a dozen other states including Florida and Ohio, would declare a fertilized human egg to be a legal person, effectively branding abortion and some forms of birth control as murder.

title: Voting With Their Wallets
description: Chart shows contributions to Erik Paulsens campaign after he testified to Congress that the F.D.A.s approval process for medical devices should be streamlined.

title: Venture Capitalists Put Money on Easing Medical Device Rules
description: One afternoon last spring, a little-known congressman from Minnesota made an impassioned plea before a House oversight committee.

title: Fighting in Yemen Intensifies
description: Explosions boomed across the capital, Sana, as mostly peaceful antigovernment protests continued.

title: A New Breed of Knee Injury in Young Athletes
description: Sometimes physicians will notice a medical trend well before science confirms its existence. That has been the case with injuries to the anterior cruciate ligament, the main ligament that stabilizes the knee joint, in young athletes. Doctors who treat kids have all been saying over and over that the numbers of A.C.L. tears are going up dramatically, says Dr. J. Todd Lawrence, an orthopedic surgeon and pediatric sports medicine specialist at the Childrens Hospital of Philadelphia. But surprisingly little firm data has confirmed that hunch.

title: Think Like a Doctor: Ordering the Right Test
description: The Medical Mystery: What tests need to be ordered to help reach a diagnosis for a young woman with chronic pain that has lasted for a decade?

description: NYT Front Page for 10/26/2011

description: determination \di-tr-m-na-shn\ noun

title: Police Fire Tear Gas at Occupy Protesters in Oakland
description: Last Updated 9:48 a.m. Riot police in Oakland dispersed hundreds of protesters with tear gas on Tuesday night as crowds tried to re-enter a plaza outside of City Hall that the authorities had cleared of an encampment earlier in the day.

title: Political Newspaper Endorsements: History and Outcome
description: Newspaper editorial pages have been endorsing presidential candidates for well over a century. On Oct. 11, 1860, the New York Times editorial page threw its hat behind a Mr. Lincoln, of Illinois, familiarly known as Old Abe, age 51, height six feet seven, by profession Rail-Splitter.
